segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Server Deployment
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Server Deployment

segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Server Deployment
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Server Deployment

segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Server Deployment
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Server Deployment

segment.source: This topic lists the features that you deploy for the MBAM Stand-alone and Configuration Manager topologies and lists the order in which you need to deploy them.
segment.target: This topic lists the features that you deploy for the MBAM Stand-alone and Configuration Manager topologies and lists the order in which you need to deploy them.

segment.source: There is a recommended configuration for each topology.
segment.target: There is a recommended configuration for each topology.

segment.source: However, you can configure MBAM server databases and features in different configurations and across multiple servers, depending on your scalability requirements.
segment.target: However, you can configure MBAM server databases and features in different configurations and across multiple servers, depending on your scalability requirements.

segment.source: Important planning considerations for both topologies
segment.target: Important planning considerations for both topologies

segment.source: Considerations
segment.target: Considerations

segment.source: Details or purpose
segment.target: Details or purpose

segment.source: Review the following before you start the deployment:
segment.target: Review the following before you start the deployment:

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Each MBAM feature has specific prerequisites that must be met before you start the MBAM installation.
segment.target: Each MBAM feature has specific prerequisites that must be met before you start the MBAM installation.

segment.source: BitLocker recovery keys in MBAM expire after a single use.
segment.target: BitLocker recovery keys in MBAM expire after a single use.

segment.source: A single use means that the recovery key has been retrieved through the Administration and Monitoring Website (also known as Help Desk), Self-Service Portal, or by using the Get-MbamBitLockerRecoveryKey Windows PowerShell cmdlet.
segment.target: A single use means that the recovery key has been retrieved through the Administration and Monitoring Website (also known as Help Desk), Self-Service Portal, or by using the Get-MbamBitLockerRecoveryKey Windows PowerShell cmdlet.

segment.source: Keep track of the names of the computers on which you configure each feature.
segment.target: Keep track of the names of the computers on which you configure each feature.

segment.source: You will use this information throughout the configuration process.
segment.target: You will use this information throughout the configuration process.

segment.source: You may want to use the MBAM 2.5 Deployment Checklist for this purpose.
segment.target: You may want to use the MBAM 2.5 Deployment Checklist for this purpose.

segment.source: Configure only the Group Policy settings in the MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management) node.
segment.target: Configure only the Group Policy settings in the MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management) node.

segment.source: Do not change the Group Policy settings in the BitLocker Drive Encryption node.
segment.target: Do not change the Group Policy settings in the BitLocker Drive Encryption node.

segment.source: If you change the Group Policy settings in the BitLocker Drive Encryption node, MBAM will not work.
segment.target: If you change the Group Policy settings in the BitLocker Drive Encryption node, MBAM will not work.

segment.source: Planning for MBAM Server deployment – Stand-alone topology
segment.target: Planning for MBAM Server deployment – Stand-alone topology

segment.source: For the Stand-alone topology, a two-server configuration is recommended for production environments, although configurations of three to four servers can be used.
segment.target: For the Stand-alone topology, a two-server configuration is recommended for production environments, although configurations of three to four servers can be used.

segment.source: The Server infrastructure for the MBAM Stand-alone topology contains the following features, which must be configured in the order listed:
segment.target: The Server infrastructure for the MBAM Stand-alone topology contains the following features, which must be configured in the order listed:

segment.source: Databases (Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database)
segment.target: Databases (Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database)

segment.source: Reports
segment.target: Reports

segment.source: Web applications (and their corresponding web services)
segment.target: Web applications (and their corresponding web services)

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: Self-Service Portal
segment.target: Self-Service Portal

segment.source: For a description of these features, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology.
segment.target: For a description of these features, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology.

segment.source: Planning for MBAM Server deployment – Configuration Manager topology
segment.target: Planning for MBAM Server deployment – Configuration Manager topology

segment.source: For the Configuration Manager Integration topology, a three-server configuration is recommended for production environments, although configurations of additional servers can be used.
segment.target: For the Configuration Manager Integration topology, a three-server configuration is recommended for production environments, although configurations of additional servers can be used.

segment.source: The Server infrastructure for the MBAM Configuration Manager topology contains the following features, which must be configured or performed in the order listed:
segment.target: The Server infrastructure for the MBAM Configuration Manager topology contains the following features, which must be configured or performed in the order listed:

segment.source: Databases (Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database)
segment.target: Databases (Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database)

segment.source: Reports
segment.target: Reports

segment.source: Web applications (and their corresponding web services)
segment.target: Web applications (and their corresponding web services)

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: Self-Service Portal
segment.target: Self-Service Portal

segment.source: System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: For a description of these features, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
segment.target: For a description of these features, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
